Class SpectralAnalysis

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.physics.classical.spectroscopy.SpectralAnalysis
public class SpectralAnalysis extends Object
Blackbody radiation and spectral analysis.

  • Method Details

    • wienPeakWavelength

      public static double wienPeakWavelength(double temperatureKelvin)
      Wien's displacement law. λ_max = b / T where b = 2.897771955e-3 m·K
      Parameters:
      temperatureKelvin - Temperature in K
      Returns:
      Peak wavelength in meters

    • stefanBoltzmannPower

      public static double stefanBoltzmannPower(double areaM2, double temperatureKelvin)
      Stefan-Boltzmann law for total power radiated. P = σ * A * T⁴
      Parameters:
      areaM2 - Surface area in m²
      temperatureKelvin - Temperature in K
      Returns:
      Power in Watts

    • planckRadiance

      public static double planckRadiance(double wavelengthMeters, double temperatureKelvin)
      Planck's law for spectral radiance. B(λ,T) = (2hc²/λ⁵) * 1/(exp(hc/λkT) - 1)
      Parameters:
      wavelengthMeters - λ
      temperatureKelvin - T
      Returns:
      Spectral radiance in W/(m²·sr·m)

    • photonEnergy

      public static double photonEnergy(double wavelengthMeters)
      Photon energy from wavelength. E = hc/λ

    • wavelengthFromEnergy

      public static double wavelengthFromEnergy(double energyJoules)
      Wavelength from photon energy. λ = hc/E

    • colorTemperature

      public static double colorTemperature(double peakWavelengthMeters)
      Color temperature estimate from peak wavelength.
